selectedVerses.text: In that day every place where there used to be a thousand vines, worth a thousand shekels of silver, will become briers and thorns.
I weighed out into their hand 650 talents of silver, and silver vessels worth 200 talents, and 100 talents of gold,
Yet all this is worth nothing to me, so long as I see Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king's gate."
The tongue of the righteous is choice silver; the heart of the wicked is of little worth.
But he answered them, "You give them something to eat." And they said to him, "Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give it to them to eat?"
